title: Introduction to chlorinated paraffins and polychlorinated alkanes
text:
Chlorinated paraffins (CPs) are commercial products that mainly consists of straight chain polychlorinated alkanes (PCAs). However, the CP products usually contain various impurities and byproducts that can make up a considerable proportion of the CP mixture.

library(DiagrammeR)

title: CP-EXPOSE - Chlorinated Paraffins and structural analogues (CPSAs): innovative exposure analysis of an extremely complex pollutant mixture threatening human health and the environment
text:
This is the draft website for our Formas project.


The navigation bars will be refined and populated once the project will start. The website will be communicated to relevant stakeholders and other researchers through our networks and social media.


The use of the R package Quarto and Github pages makes it easy to create and maintain websites without hiring external web designers or website hotels. We aim to continue maintaining the website even after the project end to make the website a knowledge base for CPs research (and to update with other future funded projects in this topic).






Project overview and work packages

title: About the project
text:
The project hypothesis

Humans are ubiquitously exposed to polychlorinated paraffins and structural analogues (CPSAs).
CPSAs constitute the main fraction of extractable organochlorines in humans.




An illustration with examples on the concept and terminology of extractable organochlorine mass fractions, CPs and CPSAs. The terminologies of short chain (SCCPs), medium chain (MCCPs), and long chain chlorinated paraffins (LCCPs) are no longer recommended to use to describe the PCAs results, according to a recent study we participated in (Fernandes et al, 2023, doi.org/10.1016/j.trac.2023.117363).
